org.odk.collect.android.location.client

Interface LocationClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GoogleFusedLocationClient

    public interface LocationClient
    An interface for classes that allow monitoring and retrieving the User's Location. Currently there are only two implementations: - GoogleFusedLocationClient: A LocationClient using Google Play Services. - AndroidLocationClient: A LocationClient using Android's existing Location Services.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  LocationClient.LocationClientListener
      An interface for listening to status changes on a LocaitonClient.
      static class  LocationClient.Priority
      Enumerates the options for preferring certain Location Providers over others.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canSetUpdateIntervals()
      Provides a way to tell if the underlying LocationClient allows the updateInterval to be set.
      android.location.Location getLastLocation()
      Retrieves the most recent known Location, or null if none is available.
      boolean isLocationAvailable()
      Provides a way to tell if the LocationClient can access the User's Location based on the current Priority settings.
      boolean isMonitoringLocation()
      Provides a way to tell if the LocationClient is currently monitoring the User's Location.
      void requestLocationUpdates(com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener locationListener)
      Begins requesting Location updates with the provided LocationListener
      void resetUpdateIntervals()
      Resets the LocationClient's updateInterval and fastestUpdateInterval.
      void setListener(LocationClient.LocationClientListener locationClientListener)
      Sets the LocationClient.LocationClientListener which will receive status updates for the LocationClient.
      void setPriority(LocationClient.Priority priority)
      Sets the LocationClient's LocationClient.Priority which will be used to determine which Provider (GPS, Network, etc.) will be used to retrieve the User's location.
      void setUpdateIntervals(long updateInterval, long fastestUpdateInterval)
      Sets the LocationClient's updateInterval (how often we would like updates) and fastestUpdateInterval (for throttling updates that come at a faster interval).
      void start()
      Prepares the LocationClient for use.
      void stop()
      Stops the LocationClient, ending any current connections and allowing resources to be reclaimed.
      void stopLocationUpdates()
      Ends Location updates for the previously provided LocationListener.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Prepares the LocationClient for use. This method must be called prior to requestLocationUpdates(LocationListener) or getLastLocation().

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the LocationClient, ending any current connections and allowing resources to be reclaimed.

        Implementations should call stopLocationUpdates() if they have been previously requested.

      • requestLocationUpdates

        void requestLocationUpdates(@NonNull
                            com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener locationListener)
        Begins requesting Location updates with the provided LocationListener
        Parameters:
        locationListener - The LocationListener to pass location updates to.

      • stopLocationUpdates

        void stopLocationUpdates()
        Ends Location updates for the previously provided LocationListener. Implementations should call this from within stop().

      • setListener

        void setListener(@Nullable
                 LocationClient.LocationClientListener locationClientListener)
        Sets the LocationClient.LocationClientListener which will receive status updates for the LocationClient. The LocationClient should hold only a WeakReference to the listener so that it does not cause a memory leak.
        Parameters:
        locationClientListener - The new LocationClient.LocationClientListener.

      • setPriority

        void setPriority(@NonNull
                 LocationClient.Priority priority)
        Sets the LocationClient's LocationClient.Priority which will be used to determine which Provider (GPS, Network, etc.) will be used to retrieve the User's location.

        If the LocationClient is already receiving updates, the new Priority will not take effect until the next time Location updates are requested.

        Parameters:
        priority - The new Priorty.

      • getLastLocation

        @Nullable
android.location.Location getLastLocation()
        Retrieves the most recent known Location, or null if none is available. This method may block if start was not called before hand.
        Returns:
        The most recent Location.

      • isLocationAvailable

        boolean isLocationAvailable()
        Provides a way to tell if the LocationClient can access the User's Location based on the current Priority settings. Must be called after Location updates have been requested.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the User's Location is currently available.

      • isMonitoringLocation

        boolean isMonitoringLocation()
        Provides a way to tell if the LocationClient is currently monitoring the User's Location.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the clientForContext is currently monitoring the User's Location.

      • canSetUpdateIntervals

        boolean canSetUpdateIntervals()
        Provides a way to tell if the underlying LocationClient allows the updateInterval to be set. Currently only the GoogleFusedLocationClient can handle updateInterval changes.
        Returns:
        Whether or the LocationClient's updateInterval can be set.

      • setUpdateIntervals

        void setUpdateIntervals(long updateInterval,
                        long fastestUpdateInterval)
        Sets the LocationClient's updateInterval (how often we would like updates) and fastestUpdateInterval (for throttling updates that come at a faster interval).

        Implementations that don't offer this feature should do nothing here.

        Parameters:
        updateInterval - How often we would like updates from the LocationClient (inexact).
        fastestUpdateInterval - The minimum interval between updates (exact).

      • resetUpdateIntervals

        void resetUpdateIntervals()
        Resets the LocationClient's updateInterval and fastestUpdateInterval.

        Implementations that don't offer this feature should do nothing here.
